titleStmt.title: B. D. Lacy to Daniel W. Lindsey
CWG13628

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: Active Militia Records - Capital Guards, North Cumberland Btn., and Three Forks Btn.
msIdentifier.idno: Box 76, Folder 864-865 1st REGT CAPITAL GUARDS CO F Frankfort Bn CORRESPONDENCE

body.p:
Owingsville
May 30th 1865
D W. Lindsay
Adjt Gen of Ky
Dear Sir
It is now important that we should have some of Barberss men or some other armed force at this place

see Gov Bramblette -- A reward was offered for Wilk Warren for the Murder of Adamas some 40 or 50 days since -- The Gov offered it & he will know all about it -- Wilk Warren is rather a crazy man than a dangerous man that is my opinion but is certainly responsible
for his acts -- He is a bad man

Yours &c
B D Lacy
County Atto of Bath County

Owingsville Ky
May 30. 1865
Lacy B. D.
County Attorney.

Asks that Barbers men be ordered to that place or some other armed force as it is very necessary for the safety of material witnesses against Wilk Warren for the murder of Adams -- says he hears that there is a Company at Warrens house now for what purpose he does not Know but fears for the worst. needs something more than the civil force to insure the execution of the Laws --

L B No 13 -- 1865 P 198
Recd A. G O. June 2" 1865.
